{{also|norden|nörden}} ==English== {{wikipedia|dab=Norden}} ===Etymology=== A loanword from Scandinavian languages, referring to the Nordic countries or to northern Europe. ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun}} # Various places, including: ## a village in [[Dorset]], [[England]]. ## a suburban village within [[Greater Manchester]], England. ## a village in {{l|en|Nevada County}}, [[California]], [[USA]]. ## a township in {{l|en|Pennington County}}, [[Minnesota]], USA. ## a town in the district of {{l|en|Aurich}}, in [[Lower Saxony]], [[Germany]]. # {{surname|en}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=dennor|Donner|Rendon|donner|nonred}} ---- ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈnɔʁdn/}} * {{audio|de|De-Norden.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-Norden.ogg|Audio (Austria)}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m||-}} # [[north]] (direction) # [[north]] (region) ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|s|n=sg}} ====Antonyms==== * {{l|de|Süden}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|Nordpol}} * {{l|de|Nordhalbkugel}} * {{l|de|Nordeuropa}} * {{l|de|Nordamerika}} * {{l|de|Norddeutschland}} * {{l|de|Nordsee}} * {{l|de|nördlich}} * {{l|de|Osten}} * {{l|de|Westen}} ===Proper noun=== {{de-proper noun|n}} # A town in [[Lower Saxony]], [[Germany]]. ===Proper noun=== {{de-proper noun|m|g2=f}} # {{surname|de}} ===See also=== {{compass|n=Nord|ne=Nordost|e=Ost|se=Südost|s=Süd|sw=Südwest|w=West|nw=Nordwest|lang=de}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:Compass points]] ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|de|lb}} {{m|de|Norden}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/ˈnoʁdən/}} ===Noun=== {{lb-noun|m|-}} # [[north]] ===See also=== * {{l|lb|Osten}} * {{l|lb|Süden}} * {{l|lb|Westen}} [[Category:lb:Compass points]] ---- ==Norwegian Bokmål== {{wikipedia|lang=no}} ===Proper noun=== {{head|nb|proper noun}} # the {{l|en|Nordic countries}} {{topics|nb|Geography}} ---- ==Norwegian Nynorsk== {{wikipedia|lang=nn}} ===Proper noun=== {{head|nn|proper noun}} # the {{l|en|Nordic countries}} {{topics|nn|Geography}} ---- ==Swedish== ===Proper noun=== {{sv-proper noun|n}} # The [[Nordic countries]], i.e. [[Denmark]] (including the [[Faroe Islands]] but not [[Greenland]]), [[Iceland]], [[Norway]], [[Finland]] (including [[Åland]]) and [[Sweden]]. ===See also=== * [[Skandinavien]] (includes Denmark, Norway and Sweden)
